title: 12/21: CBS Weekend News
summary: U.S. pursuing another oil tanker near Venezuela; Justice Department pulls down some Epstein files.

title: Is anything open on Christmas Day 2025? See which businesses are operating.
summary: Most major retail stores and grocery chains are closed on Christmas Day, with some exceptions.

title: PitchBook: crypto M&A hit $8.6B across 267 deals in 2025 vs. $2.17B in 2024; 11 crypto IPOs raised $14.6B worldwide, up from $310M from four IPOs in 2024 (Nikou Asgari/Financial Times)
summary: Nikou Asgari / Financial Times: PitchBook: crypto M&A hit $8.6B across 267 deals in 2025 vs. $2.17B in 2024; 11 crypto IPOs raised $14.6B worldwide, up from $310M from four IPOs in 2024 — Dealmaking has been driven by Trump administration's crypto-friendly policymaking — A record $8.6bn worth of crypto deals were struck in 2025 …

title: Lottery jackpots are getting bigger and harder to win. Here are the numbers.
summary: Here are the top 20 largest Powerball and Mega Millions jackpots, and the odds of winning them.

title: Pope Leo to renew call for peace during first Christmas blessing
summary: Pope Leo XIV is to deliver his first Christmas “Urbi et Orbi” blessing from Vatican City on Thursday, at the end of a year overshadowed by conflict around the world. The year ends with sources of hope for the Christian community, which celebrated its first festive Christmas in Bethlehem, in the occupied West Bank, since the start of the war in Gaza.

title: Live: Oil tanks on fire after alleged Ukrainian drone attack on Russia’s Temryuk port
summary: Two ‍oil storage tanks were ablaze at the southern ‍Russian port of Temryuk on Thursday after what regional authorities said was a Ukrainian drone ‍attack. Authorities said on Telegram that the blaze had already spread across roughly 2,000 square ‌metres. Follow our liveblog for all the latest updates.

title: Gas leak believed to be the cause of deadly nursing home explosions
summary: At least two people were killed, and about 20 others were taken to hospitals, after a gas leak is believed to have sparked two explosions and a fire at a nursing home in Pennsylvania. Lilia Luciano has more on the victims and the investigation.

title: Bari Weiss Says Pulling ‘60 Minutes’ Story “May Seem Radical,” But Necessary for “Integrity of the News”
summary: "No amount of outrage - whether from activist organizations or the White House - will derail us," the CBS News EIC said in a memo sent to staff again defending her last minute decision to pull a segment.

title: How to save money on your utility bill this winter as heating costs rise
summary: Many Americans face soaring costs to heat their homes this winter. Here are some ways to lower your monthly utility bill.

title: UK, Canada, Germany and others condemn Israel’s West Bank settlement expansion
summary: The UK, Canada, Germany and several other countries on Wednesday condemned Israel’s decision to approve 19 new settlements in the occupied West Bank, saying the move violated international law and risked fuelling further instability, and calling on the Israeli government to reverse the decision.

title: How to save on heat and energy costs this winter
summary: Cold weather spikes often mean higher energy bills. Ash-har Quraishi has tips on how people can "energy audit" their own homes and lower the cost of their monthly heating bills.

title: We asked experts to rate the U.S. economy in 2025. Here's what they said.
summary: The economy remained on track this year, defying the gloomiest predictions. That doesn't mean Americans are thrilled with how things are going.

title: US actions will not stop EU from moderating online hate and disinformation, commissioner says
summary: US visa sanctions will not stop the EU from enforcing its rules on online platforms, the bloc’s internal market commissioner said on Wednesday, after Washington imposed visa bans on individuals linked to the Digital Services Act, the EU law governing content moderation on social media. The move underscores a growing transatlantic rift over free speech and d…

title: Christmas festivities slowly return to West Bank holy city of Bethlehem
summary: The city of Bethlehem prepares to hold Christmas as celebrations are slowly returning to the holy land after celebrations were called off in the past two years due to the Israel-Hamas war. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent in Jerusalem, Noga Tarnopolsky.

title: What's open on Christmas Eve 2025? See which stores are operating.
summary: Many businesses adjust their hours on Christmas Eve, so it's best to plan ahead if you need to do any last-minute shopping.

title: Which of these eight midfield targets fits best at Man United?
summary: United are in the market for a midfielder, but which of the candidates makes most sense?

title: Chainalysis and TRM Labs estimate that $2.7B was stolen in crypto in 2025 in total, up from $2.2B in 2024; the biggest hack was the $1.4B breach at Bybit (Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai/TechCrunch)
summary: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai / TechCrunch: Chainalysis and TRM Labs estimate that $2.7B was stolen in crypto in 2025 in total, up from $2.2B in 2024; the biggest hack was the $1.4B breach at Bybit — Cybercriminals stole $2.7 billion in crypto this year, a new record for crypto-stealing hacks, according to blockchain-monitoring firms.

title: Christmas celebrations slowly return to Bethlehem, Jesus' birthplace
summary: Christmas celebrations in Bethlehem, Jesus’ traditional birthplace, are slowly returning, as the city in the Israeli-occupied West Bank emerges from the shadow of war to celebrate its first festive Christmas in more than two years. Story by Bryan Quinn.

title: California farming magnate arrested in Arizona in wife's shooting death
summary: A prominent California farmer was arrested in the shooting death of his estranged wife in a remote mountain community in Arizona, authorities said.

title: Venezuela accuses US of 'extortion' and seeks to criminalise oil tanker seizures
summary: Venezuela’s parliament on Tuesday approved a measure that criminalises a broad range of activities that can hinder navigation and commerce in the South American country, such as the seizure of oil tankers. The bill -- introduced, debated and approved within two days in the National Assembly -- follows this month's seizures by US forces of two tankers carryi…

title: Starlink says it has reached 9M "active customers" across 155 countries, territories, and other markets, up from 8M on November 5 (Polly Thompson/Business Insider)
summary: Polly Thompson / Business Insider: Starlink says it has reached 9M “active customers” across 155 countries, territories, and other markets, up from 8M on November 5 — - SpaceX says its Starlink internet has hit 9 million customers, just over a month after reaching 8 million. — The numbers close a year …

title: Mike Cavanagh Inks Comcast Contract Extension Ahead of Co-CEO Promotion
summary: Cavanagh will join Brian Roberts atop the cable company beginning Jan. 1.

title: All Bonnie Blue Wants for Christmas Is to Break Her Personal Record
summary: The adult stunt queen — one of the most searched people of 2025 — survived a legal ordeal in Bali. Now she's ready to get back on the horse: "There's days I don't have sex, which is probably shocking to some people."

title: Student loan borrowers in default could see wages garnished in 2026
summary: The Education Department signaled earlier this year that it would move to resume wage garnishment, among other forms of involuntary collection, for those in default.

title: Even store Santas are struggling to find a job these days
summary: Job listings for store Santas have plunged in recent years as more families shop online and retailers look to contain costs, a new analysis found.

summary: Federal Reserve Board announces approval of the application by National Bank Holdings Corporation

title: FDA approves Wegovy pill for weight loss
summary: The Food and Drug Administration has approved a pill version of the weight-loss drug Wegovy.

title: Consumer confidence continues to fade despite heady economic growth
summary: Concerns about inflation, tariffs and politics weighed on consumer sentiment in December, The Conference Board said.

title: U.S. GDP grew at a blistering 4.3% pace in the third quarter
summary: Economic growth blew past forecasts in the third quarter despite ongoing concerns about jobs, tariffs and inflation.

title: The U.S. economy grew robustly as Americans continued to spend
summary: The data, which was delayed from October by the government shutdown, comes as the economy takes center stage for voters and the Trump administration.

title: Dinosaur bones found almost on top of each other in Transylvania
summary: Scientists exploring Romania’s Hațeg Basin have discovered one of the densest dinosaur fossil sites ever found, with bones lying almost on top of each other. The K2 site preserves thousands of remains from a prehistoric flood-fed lake that acted like a natural bone trap 72 million years ago. Alongside common local dinosaurs, researchers uncovered the first…

title: What's behind the surge in gold and silver prices?
summary: Analysts point to rising geopolitical tensions and softer monetary policy as driving the year-end surge.

summary: Angus Whitley / Bloomberg: The Canada Pension Plan Board and Australia's Goodman agree to invest $2.6B+ in data centers in Frankfurt, Amsterdam, and Paris, starting to build in June 2026 — The Canada Pension Plan Investment Board and Australia's Goodman Group agreed to set up a multibillion dollar European data center business …

title: FCC banning new foreign-made drones, a move China calls "discriminatory"
summary: The Federal Communications Commission says it's banning new foreign-made drones, a move that will keep new Chinese-made drones out of the U.S. market.

title: Mercedes-Benz to pay nearly $150 million to settle states' emissions allegations
summary: Mercedes-Benz USA and parent company Daimler AG agreed to settle allegations the automaker secretly installed devices in hundreds of thousands of vehicles to pass emission tests.

title: U.S. Coast Guard pursuing third oil tanker off Venezuela coast, source says
summary: If caught and seized, it would be the third Venezuelan tanker taken by the U.S. this month.

title: U.S. seizes second oil tanker off Venezuela as Trump warns Maduro
summary: An elite unit of the Coast Guard seized control of a second tanker the U.S. said was carrying sanctioned oil in the waters off the coast of Venezuela. President Trump said he will not back down from his pressure campaign against Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro. Willie James Inman reports.

title: Aetna to cover IVF treatments for same-sex couples in national settlement
summary: A federal judge has approved a preliminary agreement for a class action lawsuit requiring Aetna to cover fertility treatments for same-sex couples as they do with heterosexual couples.

title: Jim Beam to pause production at its main distillery on Jan. 1
summary: The main distillery will be closed for site enhancements, the company said. The pause comes after whiskey production has dropped amid a challenging year.

title: U.S. pursuing another tanker near Venezuela, official says
summary: The U.S. seized another oil tanker off the Venezuelan coast over the weekend and a U.S. official says the Coast Guard is pursuing another sanctioned oil tanker. Willie James Inman has more.

title: Synthetic drug market disrupted in Syria after regime change
summary: Past geopolitical tensions related to the synthetic drug “captagon” are now being mitigated with the Syrian authorities’ commitment to dismantle illicit manufacturing, says the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC).

title: The Future of EVs Is Foggy—but California Still Wants More of Them
summary: Hamstrung by lawsuits, the state can’t officially keep its goal to ban new gas-powered car sales by 2035. But it’s going to keep trying.

title: Top DOJ Official Shut Down Enforcement Against Crypto Companies While Holding More Than $150,000 in Crypto Investments
summary: The post Top DOJ Official Shut Down Enforcement Against Crypto Companies While Holding More Than $150,000 in Crypto Investments appeared first on ProPublica.

title: Inside the idea of 50-year mortgages
summary: Carter Evans reports on the perceived benefits and downsides of 50-year mortgages.

title: U.S. pursuing third oil tanker off Venezuela coast, official says
summary: The U.S. Coast Guard is pursuing another sanctioned oil tanker near Venezuela, a U.S. official tells CBS News. It's another move by the Trump administration to put pressure on Venezuela's Nicolas Maduro. Willie James Inman reports.

title: Skincare industry profits from marketing products tweens shouldn't use
summary: A CBS News Confirmed analysis of a dozen skincare influencers' accounts found that many featured ingredients not suitable for kids and were undisclosed brand partnerships or sponsored posts.

title: Holiday shoppers out in force, but concerns over consumer sentiment linger
summary: Holiday shopping is in high gear, with the National Retail Federation predicting a record 159 million shoppers on what it calls "Super Saturday," with nearly a third buying gifts in stores. However, consumer sentiment is down as many Americans are concerned about their economic future. Nicole Valdes explains.

title: The real reason incomes rise and why they drop
summary: Getting ahead financially is mainly about what you earn at work, not what you make from investments. Researchers found that promotions, skills, and better jobs drive most upward income movement. But when people slip backward, falling investment income is usually the main reason. Labor builds income steadily; capital is riskier and more unpredictable.

title: Rome introduces tourist fee for some Trevi fountain visitors
summary: Tourists visiting the Trevi Fountain are now going to pay more than just the legendary coin toss over their shoulder.

title: How Europe’s new carbon tax on imported goods will change global trade
summary: The new regulation arrives on New Year's Day.

title: Trump reaches deal with 9 major drugmakers to lower prices
summary: Nine drug manufacturers will offer their drugs to Medicaid recipients at most-favored-nation discounts in exchange for tariff exemptions.

title: CPI report shows the inflation rate rose at a 2.7% pace in November
summary: Economists had expected CPI to rise at an annual rate of 3% last month.

title: Judge in nursing home bankruptcy case gives families fresh hope
summary: A bankruptcy judge blocked an attempt by a nursing home chain's primary investor to shield himself from settlement payments and liability in lawsuits over allegations of poor care.

title: Millions are about to choose the wrong Medicare plan
summary: Millions face Medicare decisions each year, but many don’t take advantage of tools that can save them money and stress. Insurance marketing often overshadows unbiased options like SHIP, leaving people unaware of better choices. Comparing real costs—not just premiums—can prevent unpleasant surprises, especially when provider networks or drug rules change. Ne…

title: Europe launches bold plan to harness twisting beams of light
summary: Europe is investing in a coordinated effort to develop high-power optical vortex technologies and train new specialists in the field. The HiPOVor network unites academia and industry to advance applications ranging from material processing to environmentally friendly photonic systems.

title: Century-old catalysis puzzle cracked by measuring a fraction of an electron
summary: Scientists have directly measured the minuscule electron sharing that makes precious-metal catalysts so effective. Their new technique, IET, reveals how molecules bind and react on metal surfaces with unprecedented clarity. The insights promise faster discovery of advanced catalysts for energy, chemicals, and manufacturing.

title: For 170 years, U.S. Cities have followed a hidden law of growth and decline
summary: Despite massive technological and industrial changes, American cities have stayed remarkably coherent in how their economies fit together. This hidden order governs how cities diversify, grow, and reinvent themselves without losing their economic identity.
